content:
• Wednesday, February 20, 2013
  • CROX

    More on Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX): Q4 beats the Street, but the company sets mixed guidance for Q1. It...

    More on Crocs (NASDAQ:CROX): Q4 beats the Street, but the company sets mixed guidance for Q1. It now expects revenue of $305M to $310M on an EPS of between $0.32 to $0.34 per share. The Street is at $310M in revenue and earnings of $0.38 per share. Shares -2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 PM
  • SNE

    Sony Corp. (NYSE:SNE) bucks a weak local tape to trade up 0.7% in the Japanese market after...

    Sony Corp. (NYSE:SNE) bucks a weak local tape to trade up 0.7% in the Japanese market after unveiling the PlayStation 4 at a New York event. The company also said earlier that it will book a $1.2B one-time gain from the sale of an online medical-service stake. Rival Nintendo (OTCPK:NTDOY +1.4%) also rallies on the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 PM

    More on Cheesecake Factory (NASDAQ:CAKE): Q4 misses EPS estimates as same-store sales were...

    More on Cheesecake Factory (NASDAQ:CAKE): Q4 misses EPS estimates as same-store sales were weakened by 0.6% due to Hurricane Sandy and results were dented by the cost of closing some restaurants. Net profit shrank 26% as operating margins narrowed to 6.1% from 8%. Shares -1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:46 PM

  • FLR

    More on Fluor (NYSE:FLR): Q4 comes in mixed, beating on its EPS but coming up just shy on...

    More on Fluor (NYSE:FLR): Q4 comes in mixed, beating on its EPS but coming up just shy on revenue. Net profit swung to a loss as the engineering and construction company recorded a significant arbitration charge related to a wind farm project. Industrial-and-infrastructure revenue +5%, oil-and-gas +25%, government segment revenue -6.6%. The company maintains its prior FY13 EPS guidance of $3.85 to $4.35 per share. The Street view is for $4.18 per share. Shares -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • AWAY

    HomeAway (NASDAQ:AWAY): Q4 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $71.6M (+22.4% Y/Y) beats by...

    HomeAway (NASDAQ:AWAY): Q4 EPS of $0.05 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $71.6M (+22.4% Y/Y) beats by $0.73M. Shares +8.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • WLT

    More on Walter Energy's (NYSE:WLT) Q4 results: $71M loss included $6.8M in impairment and...

    More on Walter Energy's (NYSE:WLT) Q4 results: $71M loss included $6.8M in impairment and restructuring charges primarily related to a reduction in spending at the U.K.'s Aberpergwm mine. Sales of met coal totaled 2.55M metric tons, up 6% Y/Y, but prices fell 39%. Outlook for 2013 remains "cautious," with sales and met coal output in line with 2012. Shares -4.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • RBCN

    Rubicon (NASDAQ:RBCN) has resumed trading and is down 17.7% in response to the ugly Q1 guidance...

    Rubicon (NASDAQ:RBCN) has resumed trading and is down 17.7% in response to the ugly Q1 guidance accompanying its slight Q4 miss. LED equipment makers GTAT and AIXG could trade lower in sympathy, particularly in light of Rubicon's comments about excess inventory at a top LED client and very weak pricing for 2"-4" wafers.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • GNK

    Genco Shipping & Trading (NYSE:GNK): Q4 EPS of -$1.06 misses by $0.18. Revenue of $49.2M...

    Genco Shipping & Trading (NYSE:GNK): Q4 EPS of -$1.06 misses by $0.18. Revenue of $49.2M misses by $4.09M. Shares -1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • TSLA

    More on Tesla: A Q1 profit is now expected; company had previously guided for a late 2013...

    More on Tesla: A Q1 profit is now expected; company had previously guided for a late 2013 profit, and the Q1 EPS consensus is -$0.13. Over 2,750 Model S units were produced in Q4 vs.~350 in Q3. 2,400 units were delivered, up from 253 in Q3; 20K deliveries expected in 2013. Net reservations at end of Q4 totaled 15K, up 2K from end of Q3. Company plans to open 15-20 new stores/galleries and double service locations in 2013. Gross margin was 8% vs. -17% in Q3, expected to hit 25% in 2H. Opex +29% Y/Y to $114.7M. TSLA -5.7% AH. CC at 5:30PM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 5 Comments
  • SAM

    More on Boston Beer (NYSE:SAM): Q4 comes in mixed, missing on its EPS but meeting revenue...

    More on Boston Beer (NYSE:SAM): Q4 comes in mixed, missing on its EPS but meeting revenue estimates. Total sales rose by 8% Y/Y strong demand for seasonal brews and newer products like Angry Orchard ciders, but net profit fell 5.1% as margins slid to 52.1% from 56.4% and prior-year results included a tax-settlement gain. Core shipment volume grew 9%, while depletions increased by 16%. FY13 EPS guidance of $4.70 - $5.10 straddles the $5.00 Street view. Shares -2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 1 Comment

    Synopsys (NASDAQ:SNPS): FQ1 EPS of $0.67 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $475.1M beats by $1.98M....

  • PPO

    More on Polypore (NYSE:PPO): Q4 misses across the board. Total sales declined by 7% Y/Y,...

    More on Polypore (NYSE:PPO): Q4 misses across the board. Total sales declined by 7% Y/Y, reflecting weak end-market demand in its Electronics and Electric Drive Vehicles segment. Consumer electronic sales were especially weak. Shares -8.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • SYNC

    Synacor (NASDAQ:SYNC): Q4 EPS (GAAP) of $0.03 in-line. Revenue of $32.2M beats by $0.11M. Shares...

    Synacor (NASDAQ:SYNC): Q4 EPS (GAAP) of $0.03 in-line. Revenue of $32.2M beats by $0.11M. Shares -9% AH. (PR) Updated 6:22 p.m.: Shares now -5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • RBCN

    More on Rubicon: Q1 guidance is for revenue of $8M and EPS of -$0.10 to -$0.14, far below a...

    More on Rubicon: Q1 guidance is for revenue of $8M and EPS of -$0.10 to -$0.14, far below a consensus of $20.3M and -$0.02. The company says it expects a drop in 6" wafer sales (85% of Q4 revenue) thanks in part to excess inventory at its largest LED customer. Also, Rubicon's largest SoS wafer buyer is seeing declining orders due to weak sales at a key customer, and pricing for 2"-4" wafers is below Rubicon's carrying cost. Shares are halted. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). Piper made a bearish call 2 weeks ago. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • WMB

    Williams Cos. (NYSE:WMB): Q4 EPS of $0.25 misses by $0.01. Cuts FY 2013 EPS guidance to...

    Williams Cos. (NYSE:WMB): Q4 EPS of $0.25 misses by $0.01. Cuts FY 2013 EPS guidance to $0.75-$1.15 vs. consensus $1.16, due to effects of sharply lower ethane and propane prices; sees 2013 cash flow from operations of $2.07B-$2.55B. Shares -2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • ASRT

    DepoMed (DEPO): Q4 EPS of -$0.07 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $26.6M (+11.9% Y/Y) beats by $0.12M....

    DepoMed (DEPO): Q4 EPS of -$0.07 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $26.6M (+11.9% Y/Y) beats by $0.12M. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)

  • ACHN

    Achillion Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACHN) announces a $125M secondary offering. Citigroup and...

    Achillion Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ACHN) announces a $125M secondary offering. Citigroup and Leerink Swann are acting as joint book-runners. The offering is subject to market conditions, with the actual size and terms not yet disclosed. Shares -5.6% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • PAY

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY) -23.6% AH after warning it expects FQ1 (Jan. quarter) revenue of $425M-$430M...

    VeriFone (NYSE:PAY) -23.6% AH after warning it expects FQ1 (Jan. quarter) revenue of $425M-$430M and EPS of $0.47-$0.50, below a consensus of $492.5M and $0.73. FQ2 guidance is for revenue of $435M-$450M and EPS of $0.45-$0.50, below a consensus of $514.2M and $0.80. The company blames European macro, lost revenue opportunities thanks to investments in services at the expense of hardware/software, higher deferred revenue, weak Brazilian/Venezuelan sales, and several project delays. Is Square also a culprit? Restructuring efforts are promised.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • CTCT

    Constant Contact (CTCT -3.8%) closes with a decent loss after SA Pro author Nicholas Pardini...

    Constant Contact (CTCT -3.8%) closes with a decent loss after SA Pro author Nicholas Pardini argues the company faces tough e-mail marketing competition on the high-end from Amazon's Sendy newsletter app, and on the low-end from MailChimp. Whereas Sendy only carries a $40 up-front fee and Mailchimp is free for sub-2K e-mail lists, CTCT charges high-volume clients $75/month and low-volume clients $30/month. Also: social media marketing rival Salesforce (NYSE:CRM) announced a new Twitter ad platform today.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • EHC

    HealthSouth (HLS +2.8%) holds on to gains made earlier this morning after the company announced...

    HealthSouth (HLS +2.8%) holds on to gains made earlier this morning after the company announced plans for a modified Dutch auction to repurchase up to $350M of common stock. The modified Dutch auction allows shareholders to indicate how many shares and at what price they wish to tender their stock. The hospital operator says it will pay between $22.50 and $25.50 per each tendered share as of midnight on March 19.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • NFX

    Newfield Exploration (NFX -8.9%) slides sharply after reporting a massive Q4 loss driven by a...

    Newfield Exploration (NFX -8.9%) slides sharply after reporting a massive Q4 loss driven by a $1.5B non-cash ceiling test writedown associated with the carrying value of its domestic proved reserves. Analysts at Jefferies note adjusted EPS were well below analyst views, and cite higher depreciation, depletion and amortization as the cause.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • XLE

    Why the tumbling price of crude matters? The energy sector (NYSEARCA:XLE) has been the clear...

    Why the tumbling price of crude matters? The energy sector (NYSEARCA:XLE) has been the clear leader in 2013's rally, notes ukarlewitz. If it turns, will another sector step up or will energy lead the way down?

     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • MDCO

    The Medicines Company (MDCO +6%) posts a big gain today after its Q4 easily topped estimates...

    The Medicines Company (MDCO +6%) posts a big gain today after its Q4 easily topped estimates this morning. Revenue jumped by 20% Y/Y, boosted by a 77.2% jump in international sales of Angiomax/Angiox.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM
  • DVN

    Devon (DVN -6.2%) slides sharply after reporting a Q4 loss including an $896M writedown of...

    Devon (DVN -6.2%) slides sharply after reporting a Q4 loss including an $896M writedown of devalued natural gas production assets. Q4 average daily oil production rose 13%, but overall daily output fell slightly as natural gas production slipped 5.9%. During the conference call, CEO John Richels said DVN may take another look at spinning off its pipeline and processing assets into an MLP.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 2 Comments
  • HPQ

    H-P (HPQ -1%), rather than Apple (AAPL -1.9%), might be to blame for Foxconn's hiring freeze,...

    H-P (HPQ -1%), rather than Apple (AAPL -1.9%), might be to blame for Foxconn's hiring freeze, thinks UBS' Steve Milunovich. Milunovich, among the first to report of a major drop in iPhone build rates for the March quarter (a report vindicated by Apple's FQ2 guidance) says his sources indicate nothing has changed. Meanwhile, Jefferies' Peter Misek (previous) claims FQ2 iPhone build orders have fallen to just 20M-25M, but believes 5S builds will start in March. CRUS -5.1%. SWKS -2.3%. TQNT -2.6%. BRCM -1.6%. OVTI -3.1%. Update: H-P states its PC ops don't rely on the Shenzhen, China facility that has seen a hiring freeze.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 11 Comments
  • CHTP

    Shares of Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP +141%) continue to soar higher on earlier reports of...

    Shares of Chelsea Therapeutics (CHTP +141%) continue to soar higher on earlier reports of positive FDA feedback and resubmission guidance on its Northera study. Based on the input, Chelsea plans to file a resubmission of the Northera NDA with the DCRP late in Q213. If accepted, the application will be subject to a 6-month review period.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 2 Comments
  • ODP

    The bloom is off the rose as both Office Depot (ODP -18.5%) and OfficeMax (OMX -7.8%) tumble...

    The bloom is off the rose as both Office Depot (ODP -18.5%) and OfficeMax (OMX -7.8%) tumble from early trading levels after the merger was announced. A conference call this morning covered a number of important financial details of the combination but here's what was missing: 1) What is the new company called? 2) Who is running the new company? 3) Where will the yet-to-be-named company run its operations from? 4) Can a board split 50-50 between OMX and ODP pedigree get things done?
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 6 Comments
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -4.1%) slides after top rival LivingSocial states it has raised $110M in a new...

    Groupon (GRPN -4.1%) slides after top rival LivingSocial states it has raised $110M in a new funding round, guaranteeing its near-term survival. Amazon (AMZN), which has a 29% stake in LivingSocial, disclosed in its 2012 10-K LivingSocial posted revenue of $536M (+114% Y/Y) and a net loss of $71M (exc. a $579M impairment charge) last year. Amazon valued its stake (the subject of a major write-down) at $52M, which implies a $179M valuation for the entire company. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • PSTI

    Pluristem Therapeutics (PSTI +4%) pops on reports that the FDA has granted orphan status for its...

    Pluristem Therapeutics (PSTI +4%) pops on reports that the FDA has granted orphan status for its PLX Cells to treat aplastic anemia.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries (NBR -6.7%) shares swoon after dismal Q4 results which Tudor Pickering...

    Nabors Industries (NBR -6.7%) shares swoon after dismal Q4 results which Tudor Pickering analysts call "messy/disappointing," saying no business line is the single culprit but lower baseline suggests weaker than expected 2013 EPS. Positives included ~$460M in net debt reduction and nine additional long-term land rig contracts, but those were "overshadowed by operational shortfall."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • CLH

    Clean Harbors (CLH +5.7%) gets a lift today after beating Q4 top line expectations. Total...

    Clean Harbors (CLH +5.7%) gets a lift today after beating Q4 top line expectations. Total revenue increased by 2.5% Y/Y on strong contributions in its Industrial Services and Field Services segments, which offset a slowdown in its Oil & Gas Field Services unit. The company also reafirmed guidance above Street expectations, maintaining its FY13 guidance of $3.72B - $3.77B in revenues. The Street view is for $3.53B.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • WEN

    Restaurant companies Wendy's (WEN +5.7%), Ruth's Hospitality (RUTH +7.1%), and Texas Roadhouse...

    Restaurant companies Wendy's (WEN +5.7%), Ruth's Hospitality (RUTH +7.1%), and Texas Roadhouse (TXRH +6.3%) show outsized gains in a sector struggling to finds its footing with margins getting pinched. The moves could be some portfolio re-shuffling by investors as the trio have been showing stronger same-store sales numbers and traffic trends than rivals.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • AU

    AngloGold Ashanti (AU -4.2%) shares are weak after reporting earnings and interesting comments...

    AngloGold Ashanti (AU -4.2%) shares are weak after reporting earnings and interesting comments from outgoing CEO Mark Cutifani, who calls negative views on South Africa "significantly overblown" but says the country’s mining sector "may be finished" if heavy labor violence returns. Tumbling gold prices aren't helping. Other South African miners also are lower: GFI -2.4%, HMY -2.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • KZIA

    Midday top 10 gainers: NVGN +46%. IMMY +33%. IKNX +29%. NTSP +29%. CRTX +22%. LZB +17%. CHLN...

    Midday top 10 gainers: NVGN +46%. IMMY +33%. IKNX +29%. NTSP +29%. CRTX +22%. LZB +17%. CHLN +16%. RVLT +15%. CMGE +14%. TCX +14%.
    Midday top 10 losers: HNR -39%. MM -36%. GMXR -19%. MEIL -19%. JAXB -18%. ANAD -16%. ODP -14%. ONCY -13%. BONE -13%. COBR -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • CAT

    Caterpillar (CAT -1.9%) is the Dow's worst performer after reporting global machine sales fell...

    Caterpillar (CAT -1.9%) is the Dow's worst performer after reporting global machine sales fell 4% in the rolling three-month period through January from a year ago, a sharp acceleration from the previous monthly report because of respective 12% and 11% declines in Asia and North America.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • YNDX

    Yandex (YNDX +3.9%) rebounds a bit from yesterday's post-earnings drubbing after JPMorgan comes...

    Yandex (YNDX +3.9%) rebounds a bit from yesterday's post-earnings drubbing after JPMorgan comes to its defense. While calling the Russian search leader's guidance "mildly disappointing," JPM argues "the fundamental story continues to look sound on growth, corporate governance, execution and FCF generation." It also sees potential for Yandex to produce "extra returns" from its ~$1B cash pile. (Q4 results) (CC transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • HLF

    Some notes from the Herbalife (HLF -2.1%) call: Company says business performing 'exceptionally...

    Some notes from the Herbalife (HLF -2.1%) call: Company says business performing 'exceptionally well' despite 'unfair' attacks, sees buyback opportunities at current levels; it has had 'short discussions' with Carl Icahn, 'but nothing concrete.' (Webcast Replay)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +1.8%) show extra volatility with the rumor mill...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +1.8%) show extra volatility with the rumor mill churning again on interest from Nestle (OTCPK:NSRGY) in the Keurig maker. Though the mix of a U.S-centric GMCR and global giant Nestle makes sense on some fronts, there's nothing concrete on a deal and the prospect for a bid is mainly post-Heinz M&A scuttlebutt.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 6 Comments
  • WIN

    After barely moving yesterday following its Q4 EPS miss, Windstream (WIN -3.8%) is selling off...

    After barely moving yesterday following its Q4 EPS miss, Windstream (WIN -3.8%) is selling off today in response to a downgrade to Sell from UBS. The firm thinks Windstream's dividend payout isn't sustainable, though the telco just reaffirmed its commitment to it. Windstream, which currently sports an 11.6% yield, generated adjusted free cash flow of $768M, and paid out 77% of that total in dividends. Can Windstream keep this up in the face of declining high-margin wireline voice revenue? Peer CenturyLink slashed its dividend last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 3 Comments
  • GNE

    Genie Energy (GNE +4.2%) spikes after reports say it won Israel's first license to drill for oil...

    Genie Energy (GNE +4.2%) spikes after reports say it won Israel's first license to drill for oil on the Golan Heights. Awarding the license could cause an international fracas, given Golan's status as occupied Syrian territory under international law.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • SIRO

    Sirona Dental Systems (SIRO -2.5%) slips after being downgraded to Neutral at Baird. The firm...

    Sirona Dental Systems (SIRO -2.5%) slips after being downgraded to Neutral at Baird. The firm says their checks indicate that pending new product launches are going to be incrementally less to revenues and could create margin uncertainty. The firm also lowered its price target on the stock to $76 from $79.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • CRIS

    Curis (CRIS -4.6%) slips after reporting a Q4 EPS loss that came up far short of consensus...

    Curis (CRIS -4.6%) slips after reporting a Q4 EPS loss that came up far short of consensus estimates this morning. Revenues were also below expectations, largely due to an absence of milestone payments, coming in at $1.69M, versus the analyst estimate of $2.28M. Earnings also declined Y/Y as well.
